channel.title: CVE Feed for AMD -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for AMD -- all products

item.title: CVE-2020-12954|2024-09-16T18:48:26.077Z -- amd -- 1st%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: A side effect of an integrated chipset option may be able to be used by an attacker to bypass SPI ROM protections, allowing unauthorized SPI ROM modification.

item.title: CVE-2021-26332|2024-09-16T17:23:38.341Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: Failure to verify SEV-ES TMR is not in MMIO space, SEV-ES FW could result in a potential loss of integrity or availability.

item.title: CVE-2020-12902|2024-09-16T16:59:09.552Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: Arbitrary Decrement Privilege Escalation in AMD Graphics Driver for Windows 10 may lead to escalation of privilege or denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2020-12904|2024-09-16T16:38:11.800Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: Out of Bounds Read in AMD Graphics Driver for Windows 10 in Escape 0x3004203 may lead to arbitrary information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2021-26326|2024-09-16T17:53:16.999Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: Failure to validate VM_HSAVE_PA during SNP_INIT may result in a loss of memory integrity.

item.title: CVE-2021-26369|2024-09-16T19:51:13.979Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%20series
item.description: A malicious or compromised UApp or ABL may be used by an attacker to send a malformed system call to the bootloader, resulting in out-of-bounds memory accesses.

item.title: CVE-2020-12920|2024-09-16T18:49:42.624Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: A potential denial of service issue exists in the AMD Display driver Escape 0x130007 Call handler. An attacker with low privilege could potentially induce a Windows BugCheck.

item.title: CVE-2021-26335|2024-09-16T18:24:42.318Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%20series
item.description: Improper input and range checking in the AMD Secure Processor (ASP) boot loader image header may allow an attacker to use attacker-controlled values prior to signature validation potentially resulting in arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2021-26348|2024-09-16T16:27:57.232Z -- amd -- epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Failure to flush the Translation Lookaside Buffer (TLB) of the I/O memory management unit (IOMMU) may lead an IO device to write to memory it should not be able to access, resulting in a potential loss of integrity.

item.title: CVE-2021-26342|2024-09-16T16:32:42.078Z -- amd -- epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: In SEV guest VMs, the CPU may fail to flush the Translation Lookaside Buffer (TLB) following a particular sequence of operations that includes creation of a new virtual machine control block (VMCB). The failure to flush the TLB may cause the microcode to use stale TLB translations which may allow for disclosure of SEV guest memory contents. Users of SEV-ES/SEV-SNP guest VMs are not impacted by this vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2021-26318|2024-09-16T16:48:55.696Z -- amd -- all%20supported%20processors
item.description: A timing and power-based side channel attack leveraging the x86 PREFETCH instructions on some AMD CPUs could potentially result in leaked kernel address space information.

item.title: CVE-2021-26341|2024-09-16T20:16:42.726Z -- amd -- amd%20processors
item.description: Some AMD CPUs may transiently execute beyond unconditional direct branches, which may potentially result in data leakage.

item.title: CVE-2022-23825|2024-09-16T17:48:09.000Z -- amd -- amd%20processors
item.description: Aliases in the branch predictor may cause some AMD processors to predict the wrong branch type potentially leading to information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2021-26378|2024-09-16T20:22:35.208Z -- amd -- epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Insufficient bound checks in the System Management Unit (SMU) may result in access to an invalid address space that could result in denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-26362|2024-09-16T19:41:16.010Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%20series
item.description: A malicious or compromised UApp or ABL may be used by an attacker to issue a malformed system call which results in mapping sensitive System Management Network (SMN) registers leading to a loss of integrity and availability.

item.title: CVE-2021-26336|2024-09-16T17:33:06.189Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%20series
item.description: Insufficient bounds checking in System Management Unit (SMU) may cause invalid memory accesses/updates that could result in SMU hang and subsequent failure to service any further requests from other components.

item.title: CVE-2022-27673|2024-09-16T17:37:43.973Z -- amd -- amd%20link%20android
item.description: Insufficient access controls in the AMD Link Android app may potentially result in information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2021-26340|2024-09-16T16:29:03.775Z -- amd -- amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: A malicious hypervisor in conjunction with an unprivileged attacker process inside an SEV/SEV-ES guest VM may fail to flush the Translation Lookaside Buffer (TLB) resulting in unexpected behavior inside the virtual machine (VM).

item.title: CVE-2020-12892|2024-09-16T17:34:18.633Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: An untrusted search path in AMD Radeon settings Installer may lead to a privilege escalation or unauthorized code execution.

item.title: CVE-2022-29900|2024-09-16T19:56:26.694Z -- amd -- amd%20processors
item.description: Mis-trained branch predictions for return instructions may allow arbitrary speculative code execution under certain microarchitecture-dependent conditions.

item.title: CVE-2020-12964|2024-09-16T18:28:27.531Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: A potential privilege escalation/denial of service issue exists in the AMD Radeon Kernel Mode driver Escape 0x2000c00 Call handler. An attacker with low privilege could potentially induce a Windows BugCheck or write to leak information.

item.title: CVE-2021-26392|2024-09-16T20:51:46.791Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20rx%205000%20series%20%26%20pro%20w5000%20series
item.description: Insufficient verification of missing size check in 'LoadModule' may lead to an out-of-bounds write potentially allowing an attacker with privileges to gain code execution of the OS/kernel by loading a malicious TA.

item.title: CVE-2021-26313|2024-09-16T19:41:53.615Z -- amd -- all%20supported%20processors
item.description: Potential speculative code store bypass in all supported CPU products, in conjunction with software vulnerabilities relating to speculative execution of overwritten instructions, may cause an incorrect speculation and could result in data leakage.

item.title: CVE-2020-12981|2024-09-16T18:19:38.577Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: An insufficient input validation in the AMD Graphics Driver for Windows 10 may allow unprivileged users to unload the driver, potentially causing memory corruptions in high privileged processes, which can lead to escalation of privileges or denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-26386|2024-09-16T17:53:15.058Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%20series
item.description: A malicious or compromised UApp or ABL may be used by an attacker to issue a malformed system call to the Stage 2 Bootloader potentially leading to corrupt memory and code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-12985|2024-09-16T17:23:19.728Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: An insufficient pointer validation vulnerability in the AMD Graphics Driver for Windows 10 may lead to escalation of privilege or denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-26372|2024-09-16T19:15:19.878Z -- amd -- epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Insufficient bound checks related to PCIE in the System Management Unit (SMU) may result in access to an invalid address space that could result in denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2020-12944|2024-09-16T17:04:09.696Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%20series
item.description: Insufficient validation of BIOS image length by ASP Firmware could lead to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2021-26321|2024-09-16T18:56:13.855Z -- amd -- 1st%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: Insufficient ID command validation in the SEV Firmware may allow a local authenticated attacker to perform a denial of service of the PSP.

item.title: CVE-2020-12988|2024-09-16T16:33:44.366Z -- amd -- 1st%2F2nd%2F3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: A potential denial of service (DoS) vulnerability exists in the integrated chipset that may allow a malicious attacker to hang the system when it is rebooted.

item.title: CVE-2021-26391|2024-09-16T17:33:16.199Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20rx%205000%20series%20%26%20pro%20w5000%20series
item.description: Insufficient verification of multiple header signatures while loading a Trusted Application (TA) may allow an attacker with privileges to gain code execution in that TA or the OS/kernel.

item.title: CVE-2021-26312|2024-09-16T17:54:14.669Z -- amd -- epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Failure to flush the Translation Lookaside Buffer (TLB) of the I/O memory management unit (IOMMU) may lead an IO device to write to memory it should not be able to access, resulting in a potential loss of integrity.

item.title: CVE-2021-26320|2024-09-16T18:34:19.728Z -- amd -- 1st%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: Insufficient validation of the AMD SEV Signing Key (ASK) in the SEND_START command in the SEV Firmware may allow a local authenticated attacker to perform a denial of service of the PSP

item.title: CVE-2021-26364|2024-09-16T20:42:13.106Z -- amd -- epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Insufficient bounds checking in an SMU mailbox register could allow an attacker to potentially read outside of the SRAM address range which could result in an exception handling leading to a potential denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-26352|2024-09-16T16:58:20.622Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%20series
item.description: Insufficient bound checks in System Management Unit (SMU) PCIe Hot Plug table may result in access/updates from/to invalid address space that could result in denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2020-12986|2024-09-16T16:58:08.554Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: An insufficient pointer validation vulnerability in the AMD Graphics Driver for Windows 10 may cause arbitrary code execution in the kernel, leading to escalation of privilege or denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2020-12891|2024-09-16T17:33:32.143Z -- amd -- radeon%20software
item.description: AMD Radeon Software may be vulnerable to DLL Hijacking through path variable. An unprivileged user may be able to drop its malicious DLL file in any location which is in path environment variable.

item.title: CVE-2021-26330|2024-09-16T18:12:54.960Z -- amd -- 1st%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: AMD System Management Unit (SMU) may experience a heap-based overflow which may result in a loss of resources.

item.title: CVE-2021-26325|2024-09-16T16:28:08.526Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: Insufficient input validation in the SNP_GUEST_REQUEST command may lead to a potential data abort error and a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-26376|2024-09-16T17:58:27.535Z -- amd -- epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Insufficient checks in System Management Unit (SMU) FeatureConfig may result in reenabling features potentially resulting in denial of resources and/or denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2020-12967|2024-09-16T18:55:13.544Z -- amd -- sev%2Fsev-es
item.description: The lack of nested page table protection in the AMD SEV/SEV-ES feature could potentially lead to arbitrary code execution within the guest VM if a malicious administrator has access to compromise the server hypervisor.

item.title: CVE-2020-12899|2024-09-16T18:44:07.969Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: Arbitrary Read in AMD Graphics Driver for Windows 10 may lead to KASLR bypass or denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2020-12897|2024-09-16T17:38:45.112Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: Kernel Pool Address disclosure in AMD Graphics Driver for Windows 10 may lead to KASLR bypass.

item.title: CVE-2021-26373|2024-09-16T16:32:39.034Z -- amd -- epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Insufficient bound checks in the System Management Unit (SMU) may result in a system voltage malfunction that could result in denial of resources and/or possibly denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-26324|2024-09-16T17:54:12.083Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: A bug with the SEV-ES TMR may lead to a potential loss of memory integrity for SNP-active VMs.

item.title: CVE-2023-31315|2024-08-27T14:54:02.319Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Improper validation in a model specific register (MSR) could allow a malicious program with ring0 access to modify SMM configuration while SMI lock is enabled, potentially leading to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2022-23815|2024-08-19T17:17:18.251Z -- amd -- amd%20athlon%E2%84%A2%203000%20series%20desktop%20processors%20with%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20graphics
item.description: Improper bounds checking in APCB firmware may allow an attacker to perform an out of bounds write, corrupting the APCB entry, potentially leading to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2023-20578|2024-08-15T16:08:19.476Z -- amd -- amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%207001%20processors
item.description: A TOCTOU (Time-Of-Check-Time-Of-Use) in SMM may allow an attacker with ring0 privileges and access to the BIOS menu or UEFI shell to modify the communications buffer potentially resulting in arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2023-20518|2024-08-15T14:20:58.400Z -- amd -- amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%209004%20series%20processors
item.description: Incomplete cleanup in the ASP may expose the Master Encryption Key (MEK) to a privileged attacker with access to the BIOS menu or UEFI shell and a memory exfiltration vulnerability, potentially resulting in loss of confidentiality.

item.title: CVE-2021-46772|2024-08-15T14:19:49.825Z -- amd -- amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%207002%20series%20processors
item.description: Insufficient input validation in the ABL may allow a privileged attacker with access to the BIOS menu or UEFI shell to tamper with the structure headers in SPI ROM causing an out of bounds memory read and write, potentially resulting in memory corruption or denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-31356|2024-08-14T15:46:39.239Z -- amd -- amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%207003%20processors
item.description: Incomplete system memory cleanup in SEV firmware could allow a privileged attacker to corrupt guest private memory, potentially resulting in a loss of data integrity.

item.title: CVE-2023-20512|2024-08-14T15:47:20.382Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%206000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: A hardcoded AES key in PMFW may result in a privileged attacker gaining access to the key, potentially resulting in internal debug information leakage.

item.title: CVE-2021-26387|2024-08-14T15:47:44.772Z -- amd -- amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%207001%20series%20processors
item.description: Insufficient access controls in ASP kernel may allow a privileged attacker with access to AMD signing keys and the BIOS menu or UEFI shell to map DRAM regions in protected areas, potentially leading to a loss of platform integrity.

item.title: CVE-2023-20591|2024-08-14T13:14:56.158Z -- amd -- amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%207003%20%20series%20processors
item.description: Improper re-initialization of IOMMU during the DRTM event may permit an untrusted platform configuration to persist, allowing an attacker to read or modify hypervisor memory, potentially resulting in loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability.

item.title: CVE-2023-31341|2024-08-13T17:51:06.170Z -- amd -- %CE%BCprof%20tool
item.description: Insufficient validation of the Input Output Control (IOCTL) input buffer in AMD μProf may allow an authenticated attacker to cause an out-of-bounds write, potentially causing a Windows® OS crash, resulting in denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-20584|2024-08-13T17:33:05.133Z -- amd -- amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%207003%20processors
item.description: IOMMU improperly handles certain special address ranges with invalid device table entries (DTEs), which may allow an attacker with privileges and a compromised Hypervisor to induce DTE faults to bypass RMP checks in SEV-SNP, potentially leading to a loss of guest integrity.

item.title: CVE-2023-31315|2024-08-13T15:37:24.501Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Improper validation in a model specific register (MSR) could allow a malicious program with ring0 access to modify SMM configuration while SMI lock is enabled, potentially leading to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2023-31355|2024-08-06T14:58:40.899Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Improper restriction of write operations in SNP firmware could allow a malicious hypervisor to overwrite a guest's UMC seed potentially allowing reading of memory from a decommissioned guest.

item.title: CVE-2024-21978|2024-08-05T17:36:02.731Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Improper input validation in SEV-SNP could allow a malicious hypervisor to read or overwrite guest memory potentially leading to data leakage or data corruption.

item.title: CVE-2024-21979|2024-08-01T22:35:34.619Z -- amd -- amd%20software%3A%20adrenalin%20edition
item.description: An out of bounds write vulnerability in the AMD Radeon™ user mode driver for DirectX® 11 could allow an attacker with access to a malformed shader to potentially achieve arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2024-21972|2024-08-01T22:35:34.611Z -- amd -- amd%20software%3A%20adrenalin%20edition
item.description: An out of bounds write vulnerability in the AMD Radeon™ user mode driver for DirectX® 11 could allow an attacker with access to a malformed shader to potentially achieve arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2024-21972|2024-07-24T18:06:16.832Z -- amd -- amd%20software%3A%20adrenalin%20edition
item.description: An out of bounds write vulnerability in the AMD Radeon™ user mode driver for DirectX® 11 could allow an attacker with access to a malformed shader to potentially achieve arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2022-23829|2024-06-18T19:01:57.007Z -- amd -- amd%20ryzen%E2%84%A2%20threadripper%E2%84%A2%20pro%20processors%205900%20wx-series
item.description: A potential weakness in AMD SPI protection features may allow a malicious attacker with Ring0 (kernel mode) access to bypass the native System Management Mode (SMM) ROM protections.

item.title: CVE-2024-21972|2024-04-23T16:36:03.933Z -- amd -- amd%20software%3A%20adrenalin%20edition
item.description: An out of bounds write vulnerability in the AMD Radeon™ user mode driver for DirectX® 11 could allow an attacker with access to a malformed shader to potentially achieve arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2024-21979|2024-06-04T17:37:40.519Z -- amd -- amd%20software%3A%20adrenalin%20edition
item.description: An out of bounds write vulnerability in the AMD Radeon™ user mode driver for DirectX® 11 could allow an attacker with access to a malformed shader to potentially achieve arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2022-23829|2024-08-03T03:51:46.075Z -- amd -- amd%20ryzen%E2%84%A2%20threadripper%E2%84%A2%20pro%20processors%205900%20wx-series
item.description: A potential weakness in AMD SPI protection features may allow a malicious attacker with Ring0 (kernel mode) access to bypass the native System Management Mode (SMM) ROM protections.

item.title: CVE-2024-21980|2024-08-05T16:06:36.216Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Improper restriction of write operations in SNP firmware could allow a malicious hypervisor to potentially overwrite a guest's memory or UMC seed resulting in loss of confidentiality and integrity.

item.title: CVE-2023-31355|2024-08-05T16:04:24.813Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Improper restriction of write operations in SNP firmware could allow a malicious hypervisor to overwrite a guest's UMC seed potentially allowing reading of memory from a decommissioned guest.

item.title: CVE-2024-21978|2024-08-05T16:05:34.019Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Improper input validation in SEV-SNP could allow a malicious hypervisor to read or overwrite guest memory potentially leading to data leakage or data corruption.

item.title: CVE-2024-21980|2024-08-05T21:00:57.665Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Improper restriction of write operations in SNP firmware could allow a malicious hypervisor to potentially overwrite a guest's memory or UMC seed resulting in loss of confidentiality and integrity.

item.title: CVE-2023-31315|2024-08-09T17:08:24.237Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Improper validation in a model specific register (MSR) could allow a malicious program with ring0 access to modify SMM configuration while SMI lock is enabled, potentially leading to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2023-20584|2024-08-13T16:53:18.373Z -- amd -- amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%207003%20processors
item.description: IOMMU improperly handles certain special address ranges with invalid device table entries (DTEs), which may allow an attacker with privileges and a compromised Hypervisor to induce DTE faults to bypass RMP checks in SEV-SNP, potentially leading to a loss of guest integrity.

item.title: CVE-2023-20513|2024-08-13T16:52:35.499Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%206000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: An insufficient bounds check in PMFW (Power Management Firmware) may allow an attacker to utilize a malicious VF (virtualization function) to send a malformed message, potentially resulting in a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-26387|2024-08-13T16:50:22.151Z -- amd -- amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%207001%20series%20processors
item.description: Insufficient access controls in ASP kernel may allow a privileged attacker with access to AMD signing keys and the BIOS menu or UEFI shell to map DRAM regions in protected areas, potentially leading to a loss of platform integrity.

item.title: CVE-2021-46746|2024-08-13T16:50:51.023Z -- amd -- amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%207001%20processors
item.description: Lack of stack protection exploit mechanisms in ASP Secure OS Trusted Execution Environment (TEE) may allow a privileged attacker with access to AMD signing keys to c006Frrupt the return address, causing a stack-based buffer overrun, potentially leading to a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-20512|2024-08-13T16:52:33.888Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%206000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: A hardcoded AES key in PMFW may result in a privileged attacker gaining access to the key, potentially resulting in internal debug information leakage.

item.title: CVE-2023-20591|2024-08-13T16:53:23.681Z -- amd -- amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%207003%20%20series%20processors
item.description: Improper re-initialization of IOMMU during the DRTM event may permit an untrusted platform configuration to persist, allowing an attacker to read or modify hypervisor memory, potentially resulting in loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability.

item.title: CVE-2023-31356|2024-08-13T16:54:23.979Z -- amd -- amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%207003%20processors
item.description: Incomplete system memory cleanup in SEV firmware could allow a privileged attacker to corrupt guest private memory, potentially resulting in a loss of data integrity.

item.title: CVE-2023-31339|2024-08-13T16:56:22.024Z -- amd -- zynq%E2%84%A2%20ultrascale%2B%E2%84%A2%20mpsoc%2Frfsoc
item.description: Improper input validation in ARM® Trusted Firmware used in AMD’s Zynq™ UltraScale+™) MPSoC/RFSoC may allow a privileged attacker to perform out of bound reads, potentially resulting in data leakage and denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-31348|2024-08-13T16:57:16.834Z -- amd -- %CE%BCprof%20tool
item.description: A DLL hijacking vulnerability in AMD μProf could allow an attacker to achieve privilege escalation, potentially resulting in arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2023-31305|2024-08-13T16:53:42.810Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%206000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: Generation of weak and predictable Initialization Vector (IV) in PMFW (Power Management Firmware) may allow an attacker with privileges to reuse IV values to reverse-engineer debug data, potentially resulting in information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2021-26367|2024-08-13T16:50:05.825Z -- amd -- amd%20ryzen%E2%84%A2%205000%20series%20desktop%20processor%20with%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20graphics
item.description: A malicious attacker in x86 can misconfigure the Trusted Memory Regions (TMRs), which may allow the attacker to set an arbitrary address range for the TMR, potentially leading to a loss of integrity and availability.

item.title: CVE-2023-20510|2024-08-13T16:52:11.777Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%206000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: An insufficient DRAM address validation in PMFW may allow a privileged attacker to read from an invalid DRAM address to SRAM, potentially resulting in data corruption or denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-31366|2024-08-13T16:57:40.561Z -- amd -- %CE%BCprof%20tool
item.description: Improper input validation in AMD μProf could allow an attacker to perform a write to an invalid address, potentially resulting in denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2022-23817|2024-08-13T16:51:45.468Z -- amd -- amd%20ryzen%E2%84%A2%203000%20series%20desktop%20processors
item.description: Insufficient checking of memory buffer in ASP Secure OS may allow an attacker with a malicious TA to read/write to the ASP Secure OS kernel virtual address space, potentially leading to privilege escalation.

item.title: CVE-2023-31310|2024-08-13T16:54:05.783Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%206000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: Improper input validation in Power Management Firmware (PMFW) may allow an attacker with privileges to send a malformed input for the "set temperature input selection" command, potentially resulting in a loss of integrity and/or availability.

item.title: CVE-2021-46772|2024-08-13T16:50:54.016Z -- amd -- amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%207002%20series%20processors
item.description: Insufficient input validation in the ABL may allow a privileged attacker with access to the BIOS menu or UEFI shell to tamper with the structure headers in SPI ROM causing an out of bounds memory read and write, potentially resulting in memory corruption or denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-31349|2024-08-13T16:57:28.998Z -- amd -- %CE%BCprof%20tool
item.description: Incorrect default permissions in the AMD μProf installation directory could allow an attacker to achieve privilege escalation, potentially resulting in arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2023-20509|2024-08-13T16:52:00.677Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%206000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: An insufficient DRAM address validation in PMFW may allow a privileged attacker to perform a DMA read from an invalid DRAM address to SRAM, potentially resulting in loss of data integrity.

item.title: CVE-2023-20518|2024-08-13T16:52:55.976Z -- amd -- amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%209004%20series%20processors
item.description: Incomplete cleanup in the ASP may expose the Master Encryption Key (MEK) to a privileged attacker with access to the BIOS menu or UEFI shell and a memory exfiltration vulnerability, potentially resulting in loss of confidentiality.

item.title: CVE-2023-31341|2024-08-13T16:57:07.052Z -- amd -- %CE%BCprof%20tool
item.description: Insufficient validation of the Input Output Control (IOCTL) input buffer in AMD μProf may allow an authenticated attacker to cause an out-of-bounds write, potentially causing a Windows® OS crash, resulting in denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-26344|2024-08-13T16:49:52.889Z -- amd -- amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%207001%20series%20processors
item.description: An out of bounds memory write when processing the AMD PSP1 Configuration Block (APCB) could allow an attacker with access the ability to modify the BIOS image, and the ability to sign the resulting image, to potentially modify the APCB block resulting in arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2022-23815|2024-08-13T16:51:43.735Z -- amd -- amd%20athlon%E2%84%A2%203000%20series%20desktop%20processors%20with%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20graphics
item.description: Improper bounds checking in APCB firmware may allow an attacker to perform an out of bounds write, corrupting the APCB entry, potentially leading to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2023-31304|2024-08-13T16:53:44.552Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%206000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: Improper input validation in SMU may allow an attacker with privileges and a compromised physical function (PF) to modify the PCIe® lane count and speed, potentially leading to a loss of availability.

item.title: CVE-2023-31307|2024-08-13T16:54:03.514Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%206000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: Improper validation of array index in Power Management Firmware (PMFW) may allow a privileged attacker to cause an out-of-bounds memory read within PMFW, potentially leading to a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-20578|2024-08-13T16:52:58.457Z -- amd -- amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%207001%20processors
item.description: A TOCTOU (Time-Of-Check-Time-Of-Use) in SMM may allow an attacker with ring0 privileges and access to the BIOS menu or UEFI shell to modify the communications buffer potentially resulting in arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2024-21981|2024-08-13T16:54:58.122Z -- amd -- amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%207001%20series%20processors
item.description: Improper key usage control in AMD Secure Processor (ASP) may allow an attacker with local access who has gained arbitrary code execution privilege in ASP to extract ASP cryptographic keys, potentially resulting in loss of confidentiality and integrity.

item.title: CVE-2023-31305|2024-08-13T18:27:50.120Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%206000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: Generation of weak and predictable Initialization Vector (IV) in PMFW (Power Management Firmware) may allow an attacker with privileges to reuse IV values to reverse-engineer debug data, potentially resulting in information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2021-26367|2024-08-13T18:04:43.359Z -- amd -- amd%20ryzen%E2%84%A2%205000%20series%20desktop%20processor%20with%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20graphics
item.description: A malicious attacker in x86 can misconfigure the Trusted Memory Regions (TMRs), which may allow the attacker to set an arbitrary address range for the TMR, potentially leading to a loss of integrity and availability.

item.title: CVE-2023-20510|2024-08-13T18:04:03.094Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%206000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: An insufficient DRAM address validation in PMFW may allow a privileged attacker to read from an invalid DRAM address to SRAM, potentially resulting in data corruption or denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-31349|2024-08-13T18:02:44.526Z -- amd -- %CE%BCprof%20tool
item.description: Incorrect default permissions in the AMD μProf installation directory could allow an attacker to achieve privilege escalation, potentially resulting in arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2021-26344|2024-08-13T18:33:40.359Z -- amd -- amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%207001%20series%20processors
item.description: An out of bounds memory write when processing the AMD PSP1 Configuration Block (APCB) could allow an attacker with access the ability to modify the BIOS image, and the ability to sign the resulting image, to potentially modify the APCB block resulting in arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2023-31307|2024-08-13T18:03:32.273Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%206000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: Improper validation of array index in Power Management Firmware (PMFW) may allow a privileged attacker to cause an out-of-bounds memory read within PMFW, potentially leading to a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-31348|2024-08-14T14:23:03.371Z -- amd -- %CE%BCprof%20tool
item.description: A DLL hijacking vulnerability in AMD μProf could allow an attacker to achieve privilege escalation, potentially resulting in arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2023-20509|2024-08-14T14:31:23.896Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%206000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: An insufficient DRAM address validation in PMFW may allow a privileged attacker to perform a DMA read from an invalid DRAM address to SRAM, potentially resulting in loss of data integrity.

item.title: CVE-2023-31304|2024-08-14T14:27:25.519Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%206000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: Improper input validation in SMU may allow an attacker with privileges and a compromised physical function (PF) to modify the PCIe® lane count and speed, potentially leading to a loss of availability.

item.title: CVE-2023-20513|2024-08-14T16:21:28.269Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%206000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: An insufficient bounds check in PMFW (Power Management Firmware) may allow an attacker to utilize a malicious VF (virtualization function) to send a malformed message, potentially resulting in a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-46746|2024-08-14T16:22:10.189Z -- amd -- amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%207001%20processors
item.description: Lack of stack protection exploit mechanisms in ASP Secure OS Trusted Execution Environment (TEE) may allow a privileged attacker with access to AMD signing keys to c006Frrupt the return address, causing a stack-based buffer overrun, potentially leading to a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-31366|2024-08-14T16:20:15.071Z -- amd -- %CE%BCprof%20tool
item.description: Improper input validation in AMD μProf could allow an attacker to perform a write to an invalid address, potentially resulting in denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-31310|2024-08-14T16:21:00.538Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%206000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: Improper input validation in Power Management Firmware (PMFW) may allow an attacker with privileges to send a malformed input for the "set temperature input selection" command, potentially resulting in a loss of integrity and/or availability.

item.title: CVE-2023-31339|2024-08-15T15:18:21.699Z -- amd -- zynq%E2%84%A2%20ultrascale%2B%E2%84%A2%20mpsoc%2Frfsoc
item.description: Improper input validation in ARM® Trusted Firmware used in AMD’s Zynq™ UltraScale+™) MPSoC/RFSoC may allow a privileged attacker to perform out of bound reads, potentially resulting in data leakage and denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-20578|2024-08-15T18:08:38.953Z -- amd -- amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%207001%20processors
item.description: A TOCTOU (Time-Of-Check-Time-Of-Use) in SMM may allow an attacker with ring0 privileges and access to the BIOS menu or UEFI shell to modify the communications buffer potentially resulting in arbitrary code execution.

item.description: Improper key usage control in AMD Secure Processor (ASP) may allow an attacker with local access who has gained arbitrary code execution privilege in ASP to extract ASP cryptographic keys, potentially resulting in loss of confidentiality and integrity.

item.title: CVE-2022-23817|2024-08-16T20:27:19.545Z -- amd -- amd%20ryzen%E2%84%A2%203000%20series%20desktop%20processors
item.description: Insufficient checking of memory buffer in ASP Secure OS may allow an attacker with a malicious TA to read/write to the ASP Secure OS kernel virtual address space, potentially leading to privilege escalation.

item.title: CVE-2023-31315|2024-08-22T05:45:00.792Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Improper validation in a model specific register (MSR) could allow a malicious program with ring0 access to modify SMM configuration while SMI lock is enabled, potentially leading to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2022-23829|2024-08-29T20:40:26.171Z -- amd -- amd%20ryzen%E2%84%A2%20threadripper%E2%84%A2%20pro%20processors%205900%20wx-series
item.description: A potential weakness in AMD SPI protection features may allow a malicious attacker with Ring0 (kernel mode) access to bypass the native System Management Mode (SMM) ROM protections.

item.title: CVE-2023-31315|2024-09-12T12:56:32.250Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Improper validation in a model specific register (MSR) could allow a malicious program with ring0 access to modify SMM configuration while SMI lock is enabled, potentially leading to arbitrary code execution.
